  • Deuteronomy 34
1 Thou shalt not sacrifice unto the Domina thy God an ox, or a sheep, wherein is a blemish, even any evil thing; for that is an abomination unto the Domina thy God.   2 If there be found in the midst of thee, within any of thy gates which the Domina thy God giveth thee, woman or man, that doeth that which is evil in the sight of the Domina thy God, in transgressing Her covenant, 3 and hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them, or the sun, or the moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have commanded not; 4 and it be told thee, and thou hear it, then shalt thou inquire diligently, and, behold, if it be true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought in Israel; 5 then shalt thou bring forth that woman or that man, who have done this evil thing, unto thy gates, even the woman or the man; and thou shalt stone them with stones, that they die. 6 At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall she that is to die be put to death; at the mouth of one witness she shall not be put to death. 7 The hand of the witnesses shall be first upon her to put her to death, and afterward the hand of all the people. So thou shalt put away the evil from the midst of thee.

 8 If there arise a matter too hard for thee in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, even matters of controversy within thy gates; then shalt thou arise, and get thee up unto the place which the Domina thy God shall choose. 9 And thou shall come unto the priests the Levites, and unto the judge that shall be in those days; and thou shalt inquire; and they shall declare unto thee the sentence of judgment. 10 And thou shalt do according to the tenor of the sentence, which they shall declare unto thee from that place which the Domina shall choose; and thou shalt observe to do according to all that they shall teach thee.
11 According to the law which they shall teach thee, and according to the judgment which they shall tell thee, thou shalt do; thou shalt not turn aside from the sentence which they shall declare unto thee, to the right hand, nor to the left. 12 And the woman that doeth presumptuously, in not hearkening unto the priestess that standeth to minister there before the Domina thy God, or unto the judge, even that woman shall die; and thou shalt exterminate the evil from Israel. 13 And all the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.   14 When thou art come unto the land which the Domina thy God giveth thee, and shalt possess it, and shalt dwell therein; and shalt say: 'I will set a queen over me, like all the nations that are round about me'; 15 thou shalt in any wise set her queen over thee, whom the Domina thy God shall choose; one from among thy sisters shalt thou set queen over thee; thou mayest not put a foreigner over thee, who is not thy sister. 16 Only she shall not multiply horses to herself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that she should multiply horses; forasmuch as the Domina hath said unto you: 'Ye shall henceforth return no more that way.' 17 Neither shall she multiply husbands to herself, that her heart turn not away; neither shall she greatly multiply to herself silver and gold. 18 And it shall be, when she sitteth upon the throne of her kingdom, that she shall write her a copy of this law in a book, out of that which is before the priests the Levites. 19 And it shall be with her, and she shall read therein all the days of her life; that she may learn to fear the Domina her God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them; 20 that her heart be not lifted up above her sisters, and that she turn not aside from the commandment, to the right hand, or to the left; to the end that she may prolong her days in her kingdom, she and her children, in the midst of Israel.
